explanation: Agent A is correct. The local pointer pNow is only used to read the library-provided tm object (pNow = gmtime(&t); check for NULL; now = *pNow;). It is never used to modify the pointed-to object, so per MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 it should be declared to point to a const-qualified type (const struct tm *pNow). Assigning the non-const return of gmtime (struct tm *) to a pointer-to-const is allowed in C and would satisfy the rule. Changing the declaration to const struct tm *pNow is the appropriate fix.
